channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11354] HConnectionImplementation#DelayedClosing does not start
item.description:
The method "createAndStart" in class DelayedClosing only creates a instance, but forgets to start it. So thread delayedClosing is not running all the time.
ConnectionManager#1623


      static DelayedClosing createAndStart(HConnectionImplementation hci){

        Stoppable stoppable = new Stoppable() {

              private volatile boolean isStopped = false;

              @Override public void stop(String why) { isStopped = true;}

              @Override public boolean isStopped() {return isStopped;}

            };



        return new DelayedClosing(hci, stoppable);

      }

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I want to know why we need DelayedClosing. I can not find the issue about it. I modify the method "createAndStart" to create the instance and start the thread, but I find that the client exit will be more slowly. I think the reason is that the thread sleeps for a while. Could we interrupt the thread when the connection is closed ?
Qianxi Zhang Perhaps we should remove this facility if it has not been used up to this and no one seems to have noticed it missing? Thanks for digging in here.
stack I think so, and I will check it again.

Ping Nicolas Liochon. You know abt this boss?

Also in DelayedClosing#chore(), I can see


}

          closeMasterProtocol(hci.masterServiceState);

          closeMasterProtocol(hci.masterServiceState);

Why called 2 times?

This is used to have a keep alive. There are two goals:

  • don't keep a connection to zookeeper from the client. This is useful only on large cluster with a lot of clients (map reduce...).
  • when the client starts to use ZK, there are usually multiple calls. So we keep the connection opened for a while. This was 3 years ago. It may not be true anymore.

closeMasterProtocol(hci.masterServiceState);

This looks like a replace all or a merge that failed . A bug for sure.

if it has not been used up to this and no one seems to have noticed it missing?

Not keeping the connection is useful only on large clusters with a lot of clients, so it's a specific case. May be we can remove this. I do remember a real performance impact if we close/open/close the connection to ZK however, but, again may be it's not true anymore...

don't keep a connection to zookeeper from the client.

Do clients keep up a connection to zk? I thought you'd fixed it so we just do the lookup and then let the zk connection go @nkeywal?

Do clients keep up a connection to zk? I thought you'd fixed it so we just do the lookup and then let the zk connection go @nkeywal?

Yeah, they should not. They have one at the beginning to get the address of the meta/root server, then they should close it once the keept alive is reached. But may be there is a bug or regression here, I haven't checked for a while...
I think we can delete DelaydClosing. Now the connection could be managed by ConnectionManager or invoker. When connection need be closed, the method internalClose could close the connection to zk.
The point was to close the connection to ZK as soon as possible. For cluster w/ a limited number of short lived clients, it's a non issue for sure.
thanks Nicolas Liochon, so how do you think what we should do about this issue? In fact, it is a bug, am i right?

Yes, if we:

  • close immediately the connection to ZK, it's likely a performance issue (w/ all the recent changes may be it's not true anymore, but I doubt it)
  • don't close the connection to ZK, it's a scalability issue (typically with a load of mapReduce clients).
Nicolas Liochon Did you add DelayedClosing? Was it around keeping up Connections a short while in case another connection needed zk else we'd let it go? You have original issue?

Did you add DelayedClosing

I haven't double checked, but I guess it's me a long time ago in HBASE-5399. It's sad there is no test for this, I guess it could have been done with the environmentEdgeManager...

Was it around keeping up Connections a short while in case another connection needed zk else we'd let it go?

Yes. I do remember I tried at the beginning to stop the connection immediately.
Nicolas Liochon Should we try and keep it then? Apply this patch so it is in action again?

Should we try and keep it then? Apply this patch so it is in action again?

Sure.
Let me trigger a QA run.

HBASE-11354 HConnectionImplementation#DelayedClosing does not start (apurtell: rev 2b6da527b31c70c5ec764e09b109fc4d3ab6704f)

  • (edit) hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/HConnectionManager.java

Looks like this is now preventing the region server (0.98) from stopping cleanly.
The only non-daemon thread:


"ZooKeeperWatcher and Master delayed closing for connection hconnection-0x2454e7

31" #119 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f2e25d00800 nid=0x2e27 in Object.wait() [0x

00007f2dece35000]

   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (on object monitor)

        at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.Sleeper.sleep(Sleeper.java:92)

        - locked <0x00000005b58f8b90> (a java.lang.Object)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Chore.run(Chore.java:88)

Andrew Purtell, Vincent Poon
Same with the HMaster actually.

thanks, forgot the
Threads.setDaemonThreadRunning

I can add that in a separate patch

thanks, forgot the Threads.setDaemonThreadRunning

Please put the patch here, we will commit as an addendum

This is an interesting case:

+1 unit 1m 18s hbase-client in the patch passed.

So the patch changed only a file in hbase-client, so only hbase-client was tested, which does not start up a minicluster.

Once the addendum is in we can start on the 0.98.23 release.
Vincent Poon
make DelayedClosing a daemon thread
let me run the server tests manually...I'll let you know the results

It's not right Vincent Poon

java.io.IOException: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

        at java.lang.Thread.start(Thread.java:705)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.HasThread.start(HasThread.java:85)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HConnectionManager$HConnectionImplementation$DelayedClosin

g.createAndStart(HConnectionManager.java:1918)

Sorry, forgot to remove the existing start()

Tests appear to pass on my local
Andrew Purtell
Thanks. I have this scheduled to go in after HBASE-15984, currently under test.
Pushed the addendum

Threads.setDaemonThreadRunning

Cool. Thanks for looking.

After the 5 minute look close to midnight, I wasn't quite sure whether that's the right thing to do or not, as it seems (going by the name) the reason for this thread running is to delay the closing of the connection, which it won't if the JVM is shut-down and it is a daemon thread.
